titleproper.value: Guide to the George Schwartz Papers <num>MC.217</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-06-05T20:22:51</date>

abstract.value: George Schwartz received his Bachelor of Science with honors in biology from New York University (NYU) in 1925. This collection contains materials relating to undergraduate biology courses in which he was enrolled 1921-1925, such as histology and embryology, as well as his honors thesis and various other lab work and papers.

p.value: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.
Identification of item, date (if known); George Schwartz Papers; MC 217; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Materials found in repository; documentation concerning provenance of these materials is unavailable.

George Schwartz received his Bachelor of Science with honors in biology from New York University (NYU) in 1925. He graduated from Bellevue Medical College in 1929.  While at NYU, he participated in activities such as the Politics Club, the Menorah Society, the Junior Show, the Paint and Powder Club, and the Stuyvesant Club.

This collection consists of one box containing class materials from George Schwartz's undergraduate biology classes 1921-1925. Consisting mostly of handwritten lecture notes, it includes other materials, such as lab work and typed papers. Also included is his 1925 honors thesis.

subject.value: Universities and Colleges -- Alumni and alumnae.

corpname.value: New York University. College of Arts and Science
